chapter-content","children":[["$","p",null,{"children":["In the colorful land of Chemisphere Kingdom, two siblings were known far and wide:"," ",["$","strong",null,{"className":"text-warm","children":"Enthalpy"}],", a warm-hearted character who always carried a glowing orb of energy, and ",["$","strong",null,{"className":"text-cool","children":"Entropy"}],", a free-spirited soul who loved creating beautiful chaos wherever they went."]}],["$","p",null,{"children":["\"We need to find the perfect picnic spot,\" announced Enthalpy one morning, holding up a map. \"Somewhere with the ",["$","strong",null,{"children":"lowest possible energy"}],".\""]}],["$","p",null,{"children":"Entropy twirled excitedly. \"But it should also have lots of possibilities for arranging our picnic blanket and food!\""}],["$","p",null,{"children":"Just as they were about to set off, a wise old turtle with a shell shaped like an equation poked his head out from behind a rock."}],["$","p",null,{"children":["\"I am ",["$","strong",null,{"className":"text-green-600 dark:text-green-400","children":"Gibbs the Guide"}],",\" the turtle said slowly. \"And I can help you find what you seek. But remember, the perfect spot depends on both the ",["$","strong",null,{"className":"text-warm","children":"heat energy"}]," you bring and the"," ",["$","strong",null,{"className":"text-cool","children":"disorder"}]," you create—and how hot the day is!\""]}]]}]}]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-6","children":[["$","$L8",null,{}],["$","div",null,{"className":"block md:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"ref":"$undefined","className":"rounded-lg border bg-card text-card-foreground border-none shadow-lg","children":["$","div",null,{"ref":"$undefined","className":"p-4","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-fredoka text-lg text-primary mb-2","children":"Gibbs Free Energy"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"rounded-md bg-muted p-3 font-mono text-sm mb-3","children":"ΔG = ΔH - TΔS"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Gibbs free energy (ΔG) tells us if a reaction will happen spontaneously. It combines enthalpy (ΔH, heat energy) and entropy (ΔS, disorder), along with temperature (T)."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-4","children":[["$","h4",null,{"className":"font-fredoka text-sm","children":"Common Questions:"}],[["$","div","0",{"className":"space-y-1","children":[["$","h5",null,{"className":"font-medium text-sm","children":"What is Gibbs free energy?"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-xs text-muted-foreground","children":"Gibbs free energy (G) is a thermodynamic potential that measures the maximum reversible work that may be performed by a thermodynamic system at a constant temperature and pressure. The change in Gibbs free energy (ΔG) determines whether a process will occur spontaneously."}]]}],["$","div","1",{"className":"space-y-1","children":[["$","h5",null,{"className":"font-medium text-sm","children":"Why is ΔG important?"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-xs text-muted-foreground","children":"ΔG tells us the direction in which a chemical reaction will proceed. If ΔG is negative, the reaction is spontaneous. If ΔG is positive, the reaction is non-spontaneous. If ΔG is zero, the reaction is at equilibrium."}]]}],["$","div","2",{"className":"space-y-1","children":[["$","h5",null,{"className":"font-medium text-sm","children":"How do enthalpy and entropy relate to Gibbs free energy?"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-xs text-muted-foreground","children":"Gibbs free energy combines enthalpy (ΔH) and entropy (ΔS) in the equation ΔG = ΔH - TΔS. This shows that both energy transfer and disorder contribute to whether a process will occur spontaneously."}]]}]]]}]]}]}]}]]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between
